title: Side Hustlin' — Test, launch, and scale income streams with purpose
description:
Learn to build, launch, and scale profitable side hustles from the world's most successful entrepreneurs. This course takes you from zero to advanced through 18 carefully curated podcast episodes featuring founders who've built billion-dollar companies—many starting as side projects with minimal capital.

Who You'll Learn From: Sara Blakely (Spanx, $1B bootstrap), Brian Chesky (Airbnb, $100B+), Patrick Collison (Stripe, $50B+), Melanie Perkins (Canva, $26B), Eric Yuan (Zoom, $100B+), Stewart Butterfield (Slack sold for $27.7B), Drew Houston (Dropbox, $8B+ IPO), Harley Finkelstein (Shopify President, $80B platform), Julie Wainwright (The RealReal, comeback after Pets.com), Kevin Systrom (Instagram, sold for $1B), Katrina Lake (Stitch Fix, youngest woman to IPO at 34), Mike Salguero (ButcherBox, $500M revenue), Daniel Ek (Spotify, $50B+), Jessica Livingston (Y Combinator co-founder, $1T portfolio), Tony Fadell (iPod/iPhone/Nest creator), Anne Wojcicki (23andMe, genetics pioneer), and more. These aren't theorists—they're practitioners who built real businesses from scratch.

Your Learning Journey:
• Beginner: Start with inspiring origin stories from founders who began with $5,000 or less. Learn mindset, validation, and how to take the first step without credentials or connections. Hear from founders who were rejected 100+ times, started in their teens, or launched in their 50s.
• Intermediate: Master launch tactics, customer acquisition, and iteration from founders who went from side projects to massive companies. Learn pivoting (Slack from failed game), comebacks (The RealReal after Pets.com), pricing, personalization (Stitch Fix), and balancing growth.
• Advanced: Scale operations, build systems, manage multiple income streams, and prepare for exits from serial entrepreneurs and investors who've seen thousands of companies. Learn from hardware legends (iPod/iPhone/Nest), genetics pioneers (23andMe), platform builders (Spotify), and Y Combinator's co-founder.

Why This Course Works: Every episode features an expert founder being interviewed—no solo host monologues or generic advice. You'll learn from people who've actually done it: bootstrapped billion-dollar companies, sold businesses for billions, scaled to millions of users, navigated FDA regulations, competed with tech giants, and built sustainable income streams. Curated from 14 diverse podcasts including How I Built This, The Tim Ferriss Show, Armchair Expert, Lex Fridman, Invest Like the Best, Acquired, Lenny's Podcast, and more.

This isn't about get-rich-quick schemes or passive income myths. It's about building real, sustainable, purpose-driven businesses—one step at a time.
_note: COURSE STATUS: ✅ COMPLETE - All 18 episodes finalized across 14 different podcasts. This is a world-class Side Hustlin' course featuring billion-dollar founders, successful exits, IPOs, and entrepreneurs who've built iconic companies. _podcast_diversity.diversity_notes: Excellent podcast diversity: 14 unique podcasts across 18 episodes. How I Built This used 3 times (once per level, maximum allowed). All other podcasts used only once. Mix of Top 200 podcasts and subject-specific shows.

_quality_summary.gender_diversity: 33% women founders (6 of 18): Sara Blakely, Melanie Perkins, Julie Wainwright, Katrina Lake, Monica Lent, Anne Wojcicki, Jessica Livingston
_quality_summary.geographic_diversity: US, Australia, Canada, Sweden, China (immigrant stories)
_quality_summary.age_diversity: Founders who started at 19, 20s, 34 (youngest woman to IPO), 41, 50s
_quality_summary.business_model_diversity: SaaS, marketplace, e-commerce, subscription, content, platform, hardware, healthcare, genetics, consignment
